metadata.title: CVE-2023-30456 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in arch/x86/kvm/vmx/nested.c in the Linux kernelbefore 6.2.8. nVMX on x86_64 lacks consistency checks for CR0 and CR4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-30456` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-197.248
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-197.248
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-197.248
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-197.248
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-197.248
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-197.248
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-197.248
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-197.248
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.13.0-197.248
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.13.0-197.248
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-lowlatency - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1119-aws - 4.4.0-1119.125
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1166-azure - 4.15.0-1166.181~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-197.248').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1119.125').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1166.181~14.04.1').
